intro: Haworthia truncata f. normalis, commonly known as the Zebra Haworthia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its compact, rosette-shaped growth and striking, zebra-like markings on its fleshy, blue-green leaves. The plant is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves. It produces small, white flowers on tall stems during the growing season. This variety is prized for its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
